member.name: T:Moq.MockExtensions
member.summary: Extensions for backwards compatibility with legacy test code that uses older features of the API.

member.name: M:Moq.MockExtensions.Verify(Moq.Mock)
member.summary: Verifies that all verifiable expectations have been met.
member.exception: Not all verifiable expectations were met.

member.name: M:Moq.MockExtensions.VerifyAll(Moq.Mock)
member.summary: Verifies all expectations regardless of whether they have been flagged as verifiable.
member.exception: At least one expectation was not met.

member.name: M:Moq.MockFactoryExtensions.Verify(Moq.MockFactory)
member.summary: Verifies all verifiable expectations on all mocks created by this factory.
member.exception: One or more mocks had expectations that were not satisfied.

member.name: M:Moq.MockFactoryExtensions.VerifyAll(Moq.MockFactory)
member.summary: Verifies all verifiable expectations on all mocks created by this factory.
member.exception: One or more mocks had expectations that were not satisfied.

member.name: T:Moq.VerifiableExtension
member.summary: Makes the Verifiable legacy members on the Moq fluent API visible.

member.name: M:Moq.VerifiableExtension.Verifiable(Moq.Language.Flow.IReturnsResult)
member.summary: Marks the setup as verifiable, meaning that a call to mock.Verify() will check if this particular setup was matched.
member.example:
The following example marks the setup as verifiable:
mock.Setup(x => x.Execute("ping")) .Returns(true) .Verifiable();

member.name: M:Moq.VerifiableExtension.Verifiable(Moq.Language.Flow.IThrowsResult)
member.summary: Marks the setup as verifiable, meaning that a call to mock.Verify() will check if this particular setup was matched.
member.example:
The following example marks the setup as verifiable:
mock.Setup(x => x.Execute("")) .Throws(new ArgumentException()) .Verifiable();

member.name: M:Moq.VerifiableExtension.Verifiable(Moq.Language.IVerifies)
member.summary: Marks the setup as verifiable, meaning that a call to mock.Verify() will check if this particular setup was matched.
member.example:
The following example marks the setup as verifiable:
mock.Setup(x => x.Execute("ping")) .Returns(true) .Verifiable();
